results.title: The Mother (2003)
results.creator_credit: Kevin Loader, BBC Film Unit and Roger Michell
results.brief_description: Having spent her whole life in the ‘accepted’ role of wife and mother, elderly May appears distant and unaffectionate. Not very loved by either of her two adult children, May and husband Toots travel to London for a visit with the family. On the sudden death of her husband, May has an affair with a man half her age, who is also her daughter’s boyfriend. The film explores contemporary life in London and the way families live with the dynamic of demands of work and relationships. It also proves age is no reason for loss of sexual desire but what about moral ethics?

results.title: The Mother
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, David Muir and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “The Australian eye III”.
Life and paintings of George W. Lambert, flamboyant Australian war artist, painter and poet, including the important painting “The Mother”. Talks of how he encouraged young painters including Roland Wakelin and Grace Cossington Smith and his involvement as a war artist and memorial sculptor. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Moth of Moonbi
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Productions and Charles Chauvel
results.brief_description: Charles Chauvel’s first feature tells the story of a country girl, Dell Ferris (the Moth of Moonbi), drawn to the bright lights of the big city where her inheritance is soon frittered away with high society revelling. A wiser Dell returns to Moonbi Station where she is beset by the cattle rustler Jack Bronson, but finally finds peace and happiness with the faithful head stockman, Tom. Cast includes Darla Townend, Colleen Richards, Charles O’Mara, Marsden T. Hassell, Doris Ashwin, Arthur Tauchert.

results.title: The Most fertile man in Ireland
results.creator_credit: David Collins, Sky Pictures, Alibi Films and Dudi Appleton
results.brief_description: Eamon is a nerdish love-lorn 24-year-old virgin who lives with his mother and works for a dating agency. In love with a local girl who works in a funeral parlour, Eamon is depressed about his prospects of getting a date with her, given his dowdy physical appearance and bumbling nature. One night Eamon is picked up in a bar, and despite protection makes the girl pregnant. This leads to the discovery that Eamon has an unnaturally high sperm count which makes him an ideal donor for childless couples. Eamon’s talent is soon turned into a thriving small business as he reaps in money from impregnating women all over Ireland, with the sanction of the Catholic Church. When Eamon manages to get lucky with the girl of his dreams, their future together is threatened by his past. The debut of director Dudi Applteon, “The Most fertile men in Ireland” is a mostly harmless comedy about love, sex, honour, parenthood and sperm. Cast includes: Kris Marshall, James Nesbitt, Bronagh Gallagher and Kathy Keira Clarke.

results.title: The Most dangerous game
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Merian C. Cooper, Ernest B Schoedsack and Irving Pichel
results.brief_description: King Kongs creators made this excellent tale a year before the famous ape burst onto the scene. A vivid retelling of Richard Connells celebrated oft-filmed story about a megalomaniac named Count Zaroff who hunts humans with a bow and arrow on his private island, and charms everyone he encounters. Joel McRae, Fay Wray and Robert Armstrong are his latest prey.

results.title: The Most beautiful place on earth: international zone
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television, Pierre des Bonnet and Martin Bunnel
results.brief_description: Shows the scientific research undertaken on Antarctica, which has been declared open for use by all mankind for scientific and peaceful purposes. This film shows the international co-operation achieved in efforts to preserve the unique environment of the continent.

results.title: The Most
results.creator_credit: Inter Video, Richard Ballentine and Gordon Sheppard
results.brief_description: A study of Hugh Hefner, creator of the fantastically successful Playboy magazine and the Bunny Clubs. He is shown with his staff in his office, at a party in his own home, talking about his ideas and beliefs, and working alone at night in the deserted office building. Music by Dudley Moore. “The Playboy Twist” sung by Tommy Danton.

results.title: The Mosquito coast
results.creator_credit: Jerome Hellman, Saul Zaentz and Peter Weir
results.brief_description: Based on the novel of the same name by Paul Theroux and adapted for the screen by Paul Schrader, the film tells the story of an eccentric inventor who, sick of seeing the world deteriorate around him, takes his family from their Massachusetts farm to the dark jungles of Honduras to start a fresh new life. However all does not run smoothly in their new jungle paradise and it is not the utopia of his dreams. Stars Harrison Ford, River Phoenix, Helen Mirren and Martha Plimpton.

results.title: The Mosquito
results.brief_description: The lifecycle of the mosquito, its breeding places, eggs, larvae, pupa, and the final stage. Methods used to combat the spread of mosquitoes are shown in detail.

results.title: The Moselle: a victory for Europe
results.brief_description: On May 24, 1964, the new waterway on the river Moselle, an important step towards European economic unity, was inaugurated. It connects the iron ore deposits of the Lorraine and the Saar, and the Ruhr Valley with the Belgian-Dutch coalmines. Shows the picturesque landscape of the Moselle area.
